text: A raven that had fallen into a vine promised to burn incense to Apollos if he saved him. But when he was released from the trap, he forgot his promise. Captured again in another strain, he left Apollos for Hermes, also promising a sacrifice. And God said to him, How shall I believe thee now, thou poor man, when thou hast deceived and denied thy first lord? If we miss our first promise, they won't believe our second.
title: El cuervo y Hermes
author: nan Esopo
